# Special Provisions
## MP Involvement in Mutinies - Attempting to overthrow the legitimate command staff is illegal, and [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] must do everything in their power to prevent it. - Should a mutiny be successful, resulting in the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] being deposed or surrendering, [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] should remain loyal to the previous Commander. - The [color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color] may be optionally skipped in the [textlink="Chain of Command" link="RMCCommandChain"], if the mutiny is successful.
## Emergencies - In emergencies, such as significant boardings or a compromised brig, imprisoned personnel may be released by the Commander, if they believe they will not be a further threat or hinderance during the emergency, also particularly if they display good behavior. - A simple red alert is not sufficient reason for release, unless the ship/base is significantly overrun.
